derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (originally as two words, denoting public welfare; compare with commonweal): from common + wealth

entry.def: The Commonwealth is an organization consisting of the United Kingdom and most of the countries that were previously under its rule.

entry.tran: 联邦，联合体(用于正式名称中)
entry.def: Commonwealth is used in the official names of some countries, groups of countries, or parts of countries.

example.ex: ...the Commonwealth of Independent States, which replaced the Soviet Union.
example.tran: 取代了苏联的独立国家联合体

entry.tran: (关系友好、有共同点的国家组成的)团体
entry.def: If you refer to a commonwealth of nations, you are referring to a group of countries who are friendly towards each other and have something in common.

example.ex: ...a commonwealth of nations without economic borders.
example.tran: 经济上自由往来的几个国家组成的联盟

means.word_mean: 1. the official name of some states in the United States (Massachusetts and Pennsylvania and Virginia and Kentucky) and associated territories (Puerto Rico)
2. a politically organized body of people under a single government;

sentences.sentence: "the state has elected a new president"
"students who had come to the nation's capitol"

means.word_mean: 3. a world organization of autonomous states that are united in allegiance to a central power but are not subordinate to it or to one another
4. a political system in which the supreme power lies in a body of citizens who can elect people to represent them

stems_affixes.word_buile: common普通的,寻常的+place处境→n.平凡的事, 平常话 adj.平凡的
common寻常的+sense意识到→能意识到日常的[一些事务]→具有常识的
common普通的,寻常的+place处境→n.平凡的事, 平常话 adj.平凡的
common公共的+wealth财富→共同的财富→共和国,联邦,共同体

means.word_mean: 共和国; 联邦, 团体, 协会
